Description: Sherd of North Ionian pottery plate, mended from two fragments; brown-buff clay; part of motif on top of rim preserved; on outside of floor, between bands with added red bands lined in white, frieze of leaves and unusual lotus flowers with centre filled with cross-hatched and dotted lozenge; traces of tondo decoration. Exterior: triple bands at top of wall and at bottom of sherd.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VII, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.734)
